intro: Soyauxia kwewonii, commonly known as the Kwewon wild bean, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in shrubland or woodland habitats, often in areas with well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying shades of white or pale yellow. The seeds are enclosed in pods and are an important food source for various wildlife species.
